PCI.BIO: Katherine Spiess is serving her second term as assistant chair of the Finance Department. Her research has focused on the stock market impact of security offerings, and her teaching interests are mergers and acquisitions, corporate risk management, and real options. She earned her B.S. and her Ph.D. from the University of Missouri. Her distinctions and awards include an All Star Paper recognition from the Journal of Financial Economics, a Kaneb Teaching Award, Outstanding Teacher in the MS-Management program, and a BP Amoco Outstanding Teacher Award.

AWARDHONOR.NAME: Journal of Financial Economics All Star Paper
AWARDHONOR.DESC: "Underperformance in long-run stock returns following seasoned equity offerings," 1995, by Spiess and Affleck-Graves was included in the JFE's list of most-cited papers since 1975 with an average of 7.1 citations per year since its publication.

AWARDHONOR.NAME: BP Amoco College of Business Administration Outstanding Teacher Award

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Mergers & Acquisitions
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: I modified a team presentation assignment to allow students to demonstrate skills in leading a class discussion as well as presenting content to the class. I also replaced a group project that I have used in past with a set of problem sets plus a live simulation of a merger negotiation to allow students to practice negotiation as well as valuation and deal structure choices.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Mergers & Acquisitions
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: I modified a team presentation assignment to allow students to demonstrate skills in leading a class discussion as well as presenting content to the class. I also replaced a group project that I have used in past with a set of problem sets plus a live simulation of a merger negotiation to allow students to practice negotiation as well as valuation and deal structure choices.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Mergers & Acquisitions
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: I've adopted a new text that provides additional detail and context for valuation of acquisition targets and have changed the case assignments and course packet readings assignments to correspond to this change.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Mergers & Acquisitions
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: I've adopted a new text that provides additional detail and context for valuation of acquisition targets and have changed the case assignments and course packet readings assignments to correspond to this change.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Real Options Analysis
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: I added a new computer software tutorial and homework case assignment to introduce students to Monte Carlo simulation as a method for evaluating real options.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Corporate Risk Management
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: Based on feedback from the first semester teaching this course, I replaced one of the lessons to provide additional review of the principles of derivatives securities.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Mergers & Acquisitions
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: I've rewritten portions of the semester-long project to allow for more in-class utilization of the groups' project work.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Corporate Risk Management
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: This was an entirely new course with a strong emphasis on case study discussions (five cases), as well as in-class exercises and lecture.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Real Options Analysis
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: I replaced one of the lessons with new content and replacing one of the existing case studies with a new case that I think better fit with my objectives for the course.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Mergers and Acquisitions
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: Added a new group project assignment that requires students to research a topic in M&A and discuss a current events case that illustrates that topic. Also made significant changes in structure of semester-long group project.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Advanced Corporate Finance
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: I significantly expanded the scope and content of a case project that I developed for this course. It is now a semester-long project with both written report components and explicit integration into the classroom discussion of numerous topics. Students are required to analyze the financial condition of the project firm, evaluate a proposed investment project, and recommend a financing strategy. The project touches on numerous topics including financial statement analysis, stock valuation, capital budgeting, and capital structure.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Advanced Corporate Finance
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: I significantly expanded the scope and content of a case project that I developed for this course. It is now a semester-long project with both written report components and explicit integration into the classroom discussion of numerous topics. Students are required to analyze the financial condition of the project firm, evaluate a proposed investment project, and recommend a financing strategy. The project touches on numerous topics including financial statement analysis, stock valuation, capital budgeting, and capital structure.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Advanced Corporate Finance
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: Added a series of new, Excel-based projects (covering capital budgeting and firm valuation) to the course.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Advanced Corporate Finance
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: Added a series of new, Excel-based projects (covering capital budgeting and firm valuation) to the course.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Mergers & Acquisitions
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: Replaced the final presentation of the semester-long M&A project with a roundtable Q&A defense of their deal structure proposal. This requires students to evaluate other groups' proposals, frame questions for the other groups to point out any weaknesses in those other proposals, and prepare to defend their own proposals against questions posed by the other groups. This is a much more active role than simply presenting their own report and listening to other student reports, and requires an additional element of critical thinking.

SCHTEACH.TITLE: Advanced Corporate Finance
SCHTEACH.PEDINN: While not technically a new course prep, I haven't taught ACF since Fall 2000 so it was effectively all new materials. Pedagogical innovations included the introduction of a semester-long restructuring project involving proposed restructuring of a real-world company. Student groups had to collect data, conduct financial analysis of the firm, write a restructuring proposal, and defend their proposals in round-table Q&A with other groups.

OFF_LOAD_TEACH.TITLE: Finance
OFF_LOAD_TEACH.PEDINN: Added additional case study and restructured the case studies to require student group presentations. Also made student groups responsible for critique/questioning of another group's case presentation. These innovations were all aimed at making the intensive-format class more interactive.

DSL.TITLE: Accuarial Exam FM Preparation
DSL.COMMENT: This course was administered through the Mathematics department, where Amy has her second major. As the supervising instructor, I met weekly with Amy to answer questions and help her prepare to take the Accurarial certification exam in Financial Mathematics. She took and passed the exam on Dec. 4, 2010.

DSL.TITLE: International Internship
DSL.COMMENT: The student will be assigned a variety of different projects throughout the semester as part of the internship. Once a particular project is identified, the student will research business articles and academic studies that are relevant to the particular project, and will generate a list of prospective readings. For example, if the student is helping with the appraisal of an acquisition, he/she will conduct a literature search to identify articles that discuss the strategies, financing, negotiation process, etc., involved with acquisitions. The professor will then approve the list and assign any further readings. The student will demonstrate understanding of the readings by writing an annotated bibliography. These readings will then serve as the foundation of a 10-15 page final paper which will integrate the student’s own practical experiences from the internship with the information that learned in the literature review. Thus the academic component of the internship will be based on a literature search/review and a final paper. The student and professor will exchange weekly emails to discuss progress and the direction of the research. Unfortunately, Kaitlin's father became gravely ill while she was in London and she was forced to return early and not complete her internship.

FACDEV.TITLE: Flipped Classroom webinar
FACDEV.DESC: An introduction to the 'flipped classroom' pedagogical model where students watch online lectures outside class and use the in-class time for problem solving, cases, critical thinking and applications.
